body.p:
I beg to acknowledge the receipt of your
letter of the 8th instant, in which you are
good enough to ask us to make a
practical trial of our system on the
rocks of the St. Gothard. –

The Machine Tunnelling Company is
ready to send over at once a Machine,
and, with reference to the offer of the
Committee to bear a portion of the
expense, I will leave the matter in
your hands, feeling sure that full
justice will be done us. –

An Experiment with a single Drill
would be useless, I presume, therefore,
that the trial will be made on the
line of the Tunnel itself, in whichKustode: case
case, a short distance will have to be
driven by hand, so as to enable the
Machine to be fixed, and an
emplacement will have to be formed
on which to put the Boiler necessary
to drive the Machinery.

We shall be happy to execute this
preliminary work at cost price, and
shall be glad to know whether you
would wish us to do so, or if you
will do it yourselves.?

The Machine that we should send
would drive a Heading of the proper
size for the Advanced Gallery, but
the number of Drills would be increased
when the machinery is made specially
for the works of the St. Gothard. – and,
of course, it will be impossible, until
the men are accustomed to the
work (and until we work with
Compressed air) to obtain the
speed that will be eventually
reached –
for the trial, a Boiler sufficient to
supply Steam to a Cylinder · 329 Metresic! steht für 0.329 Meter
(or 13. inches) in diameter will be
sufficient, and, although inconvenient,
it will be quite easy to go a
moderate distance with Steam. –

I shall be glad of your early reply
as to our undertaking the preliminary
work near Goeschenen, If you wish
us to do so, we should, immediately,
send over an Agent, who would,
shortly, be followed by the Machinery. –

In the event of our offer to
contract for the whole of the Tunnel
being accepted, I beg to assure
you that we shall be prepared with
any reasonable guarantee, for the
fulfilment of our engagement, that
may be required –

div.p:
I have the honour to be
Sir,
Your obedient Servant
